Business Partner

If you are passionate about broking services in Equity, Currency and Commodity markets as well as depository participant services, partnering with Religare offers exactly that.

Religare Edge

A powerful and enduring partnership is rooted in common values and mutual trust. The 4-leaf clover, now synonymous with Religare, stands for the pedigree, product strength, expertise and support that we offer to our business partners.

Our business partners are core to our growth strategy in the broking business, our true allies and partners in progress. Each time we push our boundaries, we take our partners along.

Eligibility Criteria

Above all, we look for ambition, drive and ethics in our business partner. The spirit of striving and never-giving-up is the most vital eligibility criteria. Everything else follows it.

know more
  • Individual, Company, LLP, or Partnership firm
  • Class 10 pass from a Government recognised institution
  • Initial investment of Rs. 3 - 4 lakhs
  • 18 years of age for an Individual/ Partner/ Director
  • Compact office space branded as per Religare Broking norms
  • Certifications in NCFM/ NISM/ BCSM/BCDE for Cash, F&O or Currency Derivative as applicable

Attention Investor

Prevent unauthorized transactions in your account - Update your mobile numbers/email IDs with your stock brokers. Receive information of your transactions directly from Exchange on your mobile/email at the end of the day - Issued in the interest of Investors.

Prevent Unauthorized Transactions in your demat account Update your Mobile Number with your Depository Participant. Receive alerts on your Registered Mobile for all debit and other important transactions in your demat account directly from Depository (NSDL/CDSL) on the same day issued in the interest of investors.

No need to issue cheques by investors while subscribing to IPO. Just write the bank account number and sign in the application form to authorise your bank to make payment in case of allotment. No worries for refund as the money remains in investors account.

KYC is one time exercise while dealing in securities markets - once KYC is done through a SEBI registered intermediary (broker, DP, Mutual Fund etc.), you need not undergo the same process again when you approach another intermediary. ye text Attention Investor ke accordion mein daal de... footer mein
